content:
s in which argu-
ments from precedents can fail:
1.  The precedent and the present case might not trulyresemble each
other in the ways that the argument claims.
2.  The respects in which the cases resemble each other might not be
importantenough to justify the same decision in the present case.
3.  The precedent and the present case might also differ from each other
in important respects that justify distinguishingthe precedent.
4.  The precedent might be mistaken or immoral enough to be overtur
